
# Top and htop are processes that allow you to see what operations are currently being performed on the machine
# and how busy (or idle) the CPUs are at the moment. It updates in realtime.

# try
top

# or
htop

# set refresh rate:
top -d 100 # delay between updates in tenths of seconds


# when output is currently showing what you're insterested in:
suspend output with <ctrl+s>; unfreeze with <ctrl+q>
